newsitem.title: CROATIA: Croatian stocks mixed, drugs firm Pliva up.
newsitem.headline: Croatian stocks mixed, drugs firm Pliva up.

text.p: Croatian stocks were mixed on Wednesday in slow trade with drugs firm Pliva recovering.
* Of seven active issues, four rose, one fell and two were flat.
* Volume was lower at 7,739 and turnover halved at 7.7 million kuna.
* Top gainer hotelier Laguna rose 60 kuna to 1,010, with 82 shares sold.
* The only decliner was Zagrebacka Banka, which edged down 21 kuna to close at 1,004. It was also the most actively traded issue on volume of 4,071 shares. -- Zagreb Newsroom, 385-1-4557075
